title: Fix data race in server.Addr()
description: Race condition between Server.Start() writing to listener and Server.Addr() reading it. Detected by go test -race. The Addr() method reads s.listener without synchronization while Start() writes to it in a goroutine.

title: Fix serve command to copy assets
description: The serve command (cmd/ssg/main.go:161) creates a builder but never calls SetAssetsDir(), so assets aren't copied to public/. This causes CSS to be missing when using ssg serve --build.
design: Add b.SetAssetsDir("assets") before b.Build() in serve command, matching the build command's asset handling
acceptance_criteria: 1. Running ssg serve --build copies assets/ to public/\n2. CSS files are accessible when serving the site\n3. Test verifies assets are copied during serve --build

title: SSG: Static Site Generator Implementation
description: Build a static site generator in Go that produces https://www.qualityshepherd.nl. Features: blog section, image assets, automatic dark/light theme, responsive design. Uses Cobra CLI, Goldmark markdown parser, html/template.

title: Phase 1: Scaffold Go project structure
description: Create directory structure per architecture: cmd/ssg/main.go, internal/{config,parser,builder,renderer,model}/, templates/, assets/. Initialize go.mod with github.com/jeroendee/ssg. Use Mixed Repository pattern.

title: Phase 7: Implement Cobra CLI in cmd/ssg
description: Root command with version info, 'build' subcommand (default action), CLI flags: --config, --output, --content. Help text and usage documentation. TDD approach.

title: Phase 8: Integration testing
description: Create sample content matching qualityshepherd.nl structure, test full build pipeline, verify HTML output correctness, test dark/light theme CSS.

title: Phase 8: Documentation and review
description: Add package documentation (doc.go files), create example ssg.yaml.example, run static analysis (gopls, staticcheck), code review per Go wiki standards.

title: Phase 1: Add external dependencies
description: Add github.com/spf13/cobra (CLI framework), github.com/yuin/goldmark (Markdown parser), gopkg.in/yaml.v3 (YAML config parsing). Run go mod tidy.

title: Phase 2: Implement internal/model package
description: Define Site struct (title, baseURL, author, navigation, pages, posts), Page struct (title, slug, content, path, template), Post struct (extends Page with date, summary), Config struct (site metadata, paths, build options). TDD approach.

title: Phase 3: Implement internal/config package
description: Load configuration from ssg.yaml, support CLI flag overrides, validate required fields, define default values. TDD approach.

title: Phase 4: Implement internal/parser package
description: Parse markdown files using Goldmark, extract frontmatter (YAML) for metadata, convert markdown to HTML, handle blog posts (date from filename YYYY-MM-DD-title.md or frontmatter). TDD approach.

title: Phase 5: Implement internal/renderer package
description: Create HTML templates matching qualityshepherd.nl design. Base template with navigation, header, footer. Page template for static pages. Blog list template (date + title format). Blog post template. Embed templates using embed.FS. TDD approach.

title: Phase 5: Implement CSS styling
description: Port BearBlog-style CSS from qualityshepherd.nl. Responsive design (max-width: 720px). Dark mode via prefers-color-scheme media query. Blog post list styling (flexbox with fixed date width). No JavaScript allowed.

title: Phase 6: Implement internal/builder package - content scanning
description: Scan content/ directory for markdown files, identify pages vs blog posts (by directory), parse all content files, generate site navigation from pages, sort blog posts by date (newest first). TDD approach.

title: Phase 6: Implement output generation
description: Create output directory structure, write HTML files (clean URLs: /about/index.html), copy static assets (CSS, favicon, images), generate index.html for homepage, generate 404.html for Fastmail compatibility. TDD approach.
